message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you this incredible product! It's a unique opportunity to own a one-of-a-kind item that I'm confident you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1800000.
Alice,  $1800000 is way above my budget. I'm very interested in this product, but I'm only willing to pay $800000. Let's see if we can find a way to make this work.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $800000 is a bit lower than I was hoping for, but I'm willing to consider it. After re-evaluating the product's value, I'm willing to meet you halfway and offer it to you for $1200000. This is a fair price considering the product's unique features and benefits. What do you think?

Alice, while I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, $1200000 is still more than I'm comfortable with.  I'm firm on my offer of $800000. This is a fair price for both of us.  Let's see if we can come to an agreement.

I understand that you're firm on your offer, Bob, but I'm still not comfortable selling the product for $800000. I'm willing to make one more counteroffer to try to find a mutually beneficial price. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $1000000. This is a compromise that I hope will meet your needs and show that I'm willing to work with you to find a deal.
Alice, I truly appreciate your willingness to negotiate.  I'm confident that $800000 is a fair price for both of us.  Let's close this deal and avoid further back and forth.

I understand that you're firm on your offer, Bob, but I'm still not ready to accept $800000. I'm willing to make one more counteroffer to try to find a mutually beneficial price. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $900000. This is a compromise that I hope will meet your needs and show that I'm willing to work with you to find a deal.
